snippet: The failure of Congress to agree on a protection law for women threatens abused immigrants.
abstract: Editorial notes that the Homeland Security Dept has again reached, before the end of the fiscal year, its annual 10,000-visa limit on special visas for undocumented immigrants who are victims of domestic violence and sexual assaults; observes that the situation, which could further jeopardize victims, is due to the failure of Congress to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act, with the blame for the delay resting squarely on House Republicans.
lead_paragraph: The failure of Congress to agree on a protection law for women threatens abused immigrants.

headline.seo: Special Visas for Abused Women Hit a Ceiling
